subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] why  'why'?
msgSnippet: Here are just a few minimal pairs (I don t have enough time to look for all those in my dictionaries): spate / spite day / die lay / lie way / why (pronounced
messageBody:
Here are just a few minimal pairs (I don't have enough time to look for all
those in my dictionaries):

spate / spite
day / die
lay / lie
way / why (pronounced with the same consonant in many dialects)
hey / hi
late / light
mate / might
they / thy

I'm sure you could find a lot more minimal pairs if you think a little about
it.

BTW Do you know the joke about the two Australians in a hospital room?

"Did you come here to die?" (= today)
"Yes to die." (= yesterday)


peter_r_guinness wrote:
> Can anyone find a minimal pair for 'way' and 'why'? If not then they
> both represent allophones of the same phomene.
> Since we seem to agree that we should use phonemic principles by
> employing lexical sets, doesn't that mean that one of them is
> redundant and that it should be deprecated? Eg: 'why' should be
> removed from the alphabet.
>
> peter
>
>
>
>
